benchmark_details.name: ODE: Open-Set Evaluation of Hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: ODE is an open-set, dynamic protocol designed to evaluate object hallucinations in multimodal large language models (MLLMs) at both the existence and attribute levels. It employs a graph-based structure to represent real-world object concepts, their attributes, and distributional associations, generating varied samples for structured queries that evaluate hallucinations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate hallucinations in multimodal large language models and improve model reliability.
audience: Researchers in AI and Machine Learning
tasks: Evaluate object existence and attribute hallucinations
Fine-tune models to mitigate hallucination effects

data.source: Various real-world datasets modeled as a graph
data.annotation: Test images with factual and hallucination questions

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on hallucination-related questions versus standard classification metrics
methodology.interpretation: Results show the effectiveness of dynamic evaluation in reducing data contamination.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluations across multiple MLLMs under varied criteria
